metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18267 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The FoFiType1C::cvtGlyph function in fofi/FoFiType1C.cc in Poppler through0.64.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infiniterecursion) via a crafted PDF file, as demonstrated by pdftops.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18267` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.11
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.11
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.11
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.11
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.11
libpoppler44 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.11
poppler-utils - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.24.5-2ubuntu4.11').
